events.message: Applicant submitted a personal loan application to cover medical expenses and some outstanding debt. The initial form was completed successfully.
The loan application was categorised as a Personal Loan due to keywords related to medical and debt repayment purposes.
A loan officer experienced in personal loans was assigned to manage and review the applicant’s file and financial background.
The initial review of the application details and documents showed all required fields completed but flagged a potential income shortfall.
Additional income verification documents and medical receipts were requested from the applicant to support the loan application.
Applicant provided the requested documentation including pay stubs, bank statements, and medical bills for further evaluation.
Credit check was performed showing a moderate credit score with some previous late payments but no outstanding defaults.
Risk assessment indicated a medium-level risk primarily due to debt-to-income ratio concerns but manageable with adjusted loan terms.
A loan offer was presented including a repayment schedule tailored to the applicant’s income and expected medical expense clearance.
Applicant responded positively to the loan offer but requested clarification on interest rate calculations and penalty fees.
Application was escalated to a senior loan officer due to applicant’s questions regarding terms and interest rate adjustments.
The loan was formally approved after all clarifications and risk mitigations were confirmed by the senior loan officer.
Funds were disbursed to the applicant’s bank account to cover personal and medical expenses as per the approved loan agreement.
A follow-up call with the applicant was conducted to ensure loan repayment schedule was clear and no further assistance was needed.
The personal loan application case was formally closed after successful funding and positive applicant feedback post-disbursement.
